summary: Completed comprehensive testing of IoT RFID + Face Recognition School Bus Tracker. All core functionality working including 3-role authentication, live bus tracking with Leaflet maps, attendance grid with color-coded statuses, notification system for identity mismatches, and demo simulation features.

design_issues.issue: Some map tiles fail to load occasionally (net::ERR_ABORTED)
design_issues.impact: Minor - map still displays correctly with available tiles

passed_tests: Login functionality for all 3 roles (parent, teacher, admin)
Parent Dashboard: Live bus map with Leaflet displaying bus location and custom bus icon
Parent Dashboard: Attendance grid with monthly view and color-coded statuses (gray, yellow, green)
Parent Dashboard: Notifications panel showing identity mismatch alerts
Teacher Dashboard: Student list with today's AM/PM attendance statuses
Teacher Dashboard: Click on student to view detailed monthly attendance grid
Admin Dashboard: CRUD operations interface for students
Admin Dashboard: Users list view with role-based filtering
Admin Dashboard: Holiday management functionality
Admin Dashboard: Search functionality across students and users
Demo simulation: Simulate scan button generates random RFID events
Demo simulation: Simulate bus movement updates GPS coordinates
Backend API endpoints: All 22 API endpoints tested and working (100% success rate)
Attendance status transitions: Verified gray→yellow→green status flow
Bus location polling: Map updates with new coordinates and timestamps
Role-based access control: Parents see only their children, teachers see assigned students, admin sees all
Notification system: Identity mismatch alerts appear for unverified scans (58% confidence example)
Session-based authentication with secure cookie handling
Attendance grid navigation between months
OpenStreetMap integration with custom bus marker icons
